result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Adam Thomas Fairchild was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #16CF20.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #16CF20.

-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to submit a DNA surcharge.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 2

signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Judge Manydeeds with RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Adam Thomas Fairchild appeared. Case called at 2:38 p.m. Atty Caton states the Diversion Agreement is on Ct.1 only. Ct.3 has been added. ADA Minser recites agreement. State will file an amended information after court adding Ct. 3 Possession of THC 961.41(3g)(t). Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1,2 & 3  in 16CF20. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possess with Intent in 16CF20 and court will withhold entry of judgment per the diversion agreement. Court finds DE guilty of Ct's 2 and 3. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 

Crt orders:

Count 2: 
-   S/W Probation for a period of 18 months

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-   Court costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

Count 3: 
-   S/W Probation for a period of 18 months. To run concurrent to Ct. 2

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-   Court costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
